examples: tender words
What he needs now is a lot of tender loving care (= sympathetic treatment).
He felt tender and loving towards her.
Her expression became soft, almost tender.
The letters to Penelope are achingly tender.

meanings.def: easy to bite through and cut
examples: This meat is extremely tender.
Boil the beans until they are tender.
four large slices of tender chicken
My leg is still very tender where I banged it.
The back of my neck feels very tender.
tender young plants

meanings.def: used in connection with somebody who is still young and does not have much experience
examples: He left home at the tender age of 15.
She shouldn't be having to deal with problems like this at such a tender age.

idioms.idiom: at a tender age | at the tender age of…
idioms.def: used in connection with somebody who is still young and does not have much experience
examples: He left home at the tender age of 15.
She shouldn't be having to deal with problems like this at such a tender age.

meanings.def: a formal offer to supply goods or do work at a stated price
examples: Cleaning services have been put out to tender (= companies have been asked to make offers to supply these services).
a competitive tender
A local firm submitted the lowest tender.
The bus company is inviting tenders for a number of new buses.
The building of the new school will go out to tender.
The property is to be sold by tender.

meanings.def: a truck attached to a steam engine, carrying fuel and water
a small boat, used for carrying people or goods between a larger boat and land
to make a formal offer to supply goods or do work at a stated price
examples: Local firms were invited to tender for the building contract.
competitive tendering

meanings.def: to offer or give something to somebody
examples: He has tendered his resignation to the prime minister.
